DataElement.definition: Records the method of acquisition or source for the specimen under consideration.
DataElement.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElement.changeDescription: 3/1/22 jk versioned/released to use v2 of VD with updated max length and PVs. 12/17/21 mr Added alt name, AQT, ref doc, MCL Biospecimen CSI.  4/21/21 jk added SRRS CSI.  10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.   3/27/19 jk removed dup terms from CDE long name.  1/30/2019 smt - created for MCL specimen tracking content.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2/6/24 Added CDS Alt name, def and CSI. BF;

DataElementConcept.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The process by which something is acquired or obtained._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.  9/9/19 jk txfr ownership to MCL; revised concept mapping for consistency with MCL CDE format; content part of obsolete EDRN model load.  2/28/17 changed context from Test to EDRN. jk

ObjectClass.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.definition: Records the method of acquisition or source for the specimen under consideration._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/1/22 jk found Draft Mod VD, verified/updated PVs to include all in v1.  1/13/21 jk Versioned to correct max size, add 4 HTAN PVs. 1/12/21 jk added 7 PVs for PCA pilot per Jan 2021 Data Dictionary review.  10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.   1/31/19 smt Created for MCL

ValueMeaning.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.definition: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

ValueMeaning.definition: Autopsy; an examination and dissection of a dead body to determine cause of death or the changes produced by disease.

Concepts.definition: A postmortem examination of the body that includes an examination of the internal organs and structures after dissection to determine the cause of death and the nature of pathological changes.

ValueMeaning.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.definition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.definition: A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage.

Concepts.definition: A small volume of blood removed for testing or storage.

ValueMeaning.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.
ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated system generated definition with current NCIt definition. mc 11/12/12

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
4/24/25 Added Alt Name. sl
2023.8.15 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not provided or available.

Concepts.definition: Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.definition: Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.
Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.definition: Removal skin tissue, for microscopic examination, using a blade oriented in the horizontal plane of the skin surface.

Concepts.definition: Removal skin tissue, for microscopic examination, using a blade oriented in the horizontal plane of the skin surface.

ValueMeaning.definition: Removal of a disk of skin tissue, for microscopic examination, using a punch.

Concepts.definition: Removal of a disk of skin tissue, for microscopic examination, using a punch.

ValueMeaning.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

ValueMeaning.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a specially-designed endoscope consisting of a slender flexible forceps with movable cup-shaped jaws. The jaws are closed around the tissue to be collected and while closed the forceps are withdrawn to capture the biopsy tissue.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a specially-designed endoscope consisting of a slender flexible forceps with movable cup-shaped jaws. The jaws are closed around the tissue to be collected and while closed the forceps are withdrawn to capture the biopsy tissue.

ValueMeaning.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.definition: Surgical excision of all or part of the pancreas and duodenum.

Concepts.definition: Surgical excision of all or part of the pancreas and duodenum.

ConceptualDomain.definition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
